intro: Akkermannia, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Akkermannia species typically grow as herbaceous perennials or shrubs, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
